summary: SummaryBaBylissPRO Nano Titanium Dryer's combination of power, speed and design that offers both heavy-duty 2000-watt performance and lightweight, ergonomic handling.
details: DetailsFeaturesLong-life high torque DC motor2000 wattsNano Titanium heat technologyTrue Ion generator6 heat/speed settingsLightweight, ergonomic handingRemovable filterCool shot buttonConcentrator nozzle9 ft power cordLimited 4 year manufacturer warrantyBenefitsPowerful 2000 watts for faster dryingHeat is evenly distributed and maintained at constant temperatureIonic technology reduces frizz for sleek and shiny resultsGreat for all hair typesItem 2287409

reviews.headline: No
reviews.comments: Goes out very quickly  overpriced

reviews.headline: Do Not Buy
reviews.comments: 2 weeks of owning this dryer the medium setting stopped working all together. The diffuser dose NOT and will NOT stay on no matter how hard I pushed down on it, I had to rubberband the diffiuser on and only use  the hotter setting until I purchased different brand hair dryer. Not only is it  absurd, obnoxious, wasteful of time, money and the environment due to shipping wastes it is down right a rip off, cheap and a total design fail to have any dryer on the market that does have a diffuser that screws on and locks.Everybody knows attaching these ridiclously large tools to a hair dryer makes the dryers nozzle end off balance and top heavy if the the tools,like in thes case a diffuser, only slide on and it was what, not clicking onto to something it will slide off. By now it is ovious companies know this design flaw and have not improved it, if not then they are not testing their product or testing them and cheating us. Corperations are, like BabyBliss, are creating products that have attachments that flawd and since this diffiuser isnt fitting with another dryer it is now landfill, unaccpetable. The technology and ablilty is there to put threads on a dryer nozzle to  screw on a diffuser to the nozzle end of dryer their just cheap and are captializing on us.

reviews.headline: I wouldn't buy this again.
reviews.comments: I was told by the sales clerk this was the best hair dryer for hair that frizzes. It didn't help my hair.  I spent alot for this hair dryer. Very disappointed.

reviews.headline: Yes I would buy this again
reviews.comments: I love this blow dryer

reviews.headline: BaBylissPro Nano Titanium Dryer
reviews.comments: This is a great dryer that has lasted me more than 15 years, really. It's powerful motor has held up to (& still going strong as I've never dropped it) drying my thick, course, straight hair throughout many styles and lengths. Overall BaByliss products are effective, very dependable and reasonably priced when on sale.

reviews.headline: I love the drying power of this blowdryer.
reviews.comments: I love that this blowdryer is lightweight and has great dryiing power.   It works great on my thick, coarse, wavy hair.  The reason I didn't give it five stars is because of a couple of design flaws.  The first one isn't a big deal and just takes some getting used to.  The switch on the dryer is in reverse to all other dryers I have owned.  To turn on or increase power, you press down as opposed to up.  Again not a deal breaker.  The second one is a bit more of a deal though.  The diffuser attachment doesn't lock on like most blowdryers.  It simply just slides on,which as you guessed it, causes it to fall off often.  I hope they fix this on future models.  Otherwise is overall a good blow dryer.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: Fast, light dryer

reviews.headline: I love this hair dryer!
reviews.comments:
This was the third hair dryer I tried, and frankly, I was getting a bit discouraged that I would ever find one that checked all the boxes for what I was looking for.  But the third time was the charm, when I brought this home!  It dries my hair quickly (but doesn't leave it looking dried out), doesn't blow my hair all over, leaving it a tangled mess, and seems to leave it looking smooth and polished!  It directs the air flow nicely (even without using the concentrator), and the choices of fan speeds and temperatures gives you a nice range for exactly what you need  (including the added cool shot)!  It has a really long cord (well, longer than some of the driers I tried), so you have freedom to move, twist, twirl (you get the idea) - you're not tethered to the electrical outlet on a short cord and not able to move.
I've only had this a few weeks, but I've used it enough to know that I love it!

reviews.headline: Light weight !
reviews.comments: Love this blow dryer! As a person who prefers to blow dry their hair very often, this is the best light weight dryer to use. It dries hair quick.

reviews.headline: Disappointed
reviews.comments: It takes FOREVER to dry my hair. I ended up going back to my cheaper yet powerful hair dryer. I don't recommend, its a waste of money.

reviews.headline: I would buy this product again and again.
reviews.comments: I love how much quicker my hair gets dried with this hair dryer. I also liked the price . Great deal on a great product. I will recommend this dryer to my sister. I will highly recommend it to everyone.

reviews.headline: Second one of these I've owned
reviews.comments: My previous dryer, which I had had for several years, was developing a bad connection in the cord.  The thicker piece of rubber just below the dryer handle had broken off years ago and the cord was probably developing a break inside, and the dryer would periodically cut out.  Aside from that it still worked great.  My sister and niece (former hairdresser) also have the same model.  Hope I have as good of luck with this one.

reviews.headline: I would buy this product again and again
reviews.comments: I have thick, coarse hair and this dryer is the best. I have had mine for several years and it's still kicking. Will buy another one when the time comes!

reviews.headline: Best Hairdryer Ever
reviews.comments: This is my second BaByliss hair dryer.  The first was used for many years and passed on to my daughter with the intention of buying another well-known brand.  After reading the reviews on the "other" brand, I decided to buy another BaByliss. I'm glad I stuck with a trusted product. This dryer helps with frizz control, is light weight, fairly quiet and dries quickly! You will not regret your decision!

reviews.headline: Excellent!
reviews.comments: Love my BaBylissPro dryer!

reviews.headline: Best dryer I've ever used
reviews.comments: The setting options make it easy for me to dry for my natural wavy curls.

reviews.headline: Love this little guy!
reviews.comments: Love that this hair dryer is small, perfect size 4 for me, works well to dry fast and my hair is smooth afterwards.  Also my store stocked it so I could get it right away without having to wait for shipment.

reviews.headline: It works well if you don't need attachments
reviews.comments: It does a good job of drying my hair but I don't like that the attachments don't stay on. They constantly fall off which is frustrating while drying my hair.

reviews.headline: Really like it
reviews.comments: I bought this as an inexpensive hairdrier and it produced! I hate that the attachment falls off though. Otherwise good!

reviews.headline: Great dryer
reviews.comments: It's a great hairdryer, and I thought it was at a good price.  It's lightweight, and dries my hair quickly.

faceoff_positive.comments: I didn't want to believe that a hair dryer could make a difference in how my hair actually dried. Heated blown air is all the same, right? Well, that was my long-held theory for many years...until I purchased this dryer. I tried to give myself the same blow-out as my skilled stylist: I used the exact same products and even the same round brush! Alas, my long, thick coarse hair ALWAYS frizzed, no matter what. It dawned on me that the only difference was the hair dryer. I began an in-depth investigation of hair dryers and quickly learned that most of the top-rated dryers exceeded my monthly car loan payment. Uh, no, I don't think so. But was I willing to spend just a little more than normal on the chance that I could eliminate dryer frizz? Absolutely! Based on positive reviews, the reasonable price, and a coupon, I took a chance on the BaByliss Nano Titanium dryer. Much to my surprise, it actually made a difference! My hair dries much faster with less frizz at the highest settings (not completely frizz-free, mind you, but any reduction is greatly appreciated). The dryer weighs substantially less than my old Revlon, and I am able to completely dry my hair without working up a sweat (a boon to any gal approaching or experiencing menopause!). It has a variety of settings, so I think it's possible to decrease the frizz even more by using the low heat/low speed setting if one has the time. Overall, I'm impressed with what this dryer has done for my hair so far and would recommend it to anyone looking to reduce the frizzies without draining their bank account.
faceoff_positive.headline: Wow, It Actually Made a Difference!

faceoff_negative.comments: I bought this after my hairdresser recommended it and I really wanted to love it. But I just didn't. The pluses are it's pretty light weight and it dries my hair fast. The problem is my hair looks awful after it's dried. The heat is so low and the air is so forceful that my hair is blown all over the place, and it blows right off the round brush. And the buttons are placed right where you hold the handle. They are flip on and off (not slide up and down). So every time I move my hand (which is a lot because I'm trying to control the ridiculous wind tunnel this thing creates), I accidentally change the airflow, heat setting or shut the thing off altogether. For the price, I was expecting to be wowed. I've had $15 blow dryers that were designed better than this.
faceoff_negative.headline: Such a disappointment
